availability.p: This keyboarded and encoded edition of the work described above is co-owned by the institutions providing financial support to the Early English Books Online Text Creation Partnership. This Phase I text is available for reuse, according to the terms of Creative Commons 0 1.0 Universal. The text can be copied, modified, distributed and performed, even for commercial purposes, all without asking permission.

projectDesc.p: Created by converting TCP files to TEI P5 using tcp2tei.xsl, TEI @ Oxford.

editorialDecl.p: EEBO-TCP is a partnership between the Universities of Michigan and Oxford and the publisher ProQuest to create accurately transcribed and encoded texts based on the image sets published by ProQuest via their Early English Books Online (EEBO) database (http://eebo.chadwyck.com). The general aim of EEBO-TCP is to encode one copy (usually the first edition) of every monographic English-language title published between 1473 and 1700 available in EEBO.

EEBO-TCP aimed to produce large quantities of textual data within the usual project restraints of time and funding, and therefore chose to create diplomatic transcriptions (as opposed to critical editions) with light-touch, mainly structural encoding based on the Text Encoding Initiative (http://www.tei-c.org).

The EEBO-TCP project was divided into two phases. The 25,363 texts created during Phase 1 of the project have been released into the public domain as of 1 January 2015. Anyone can now take and use these texts for their own purposes, but we respectfully request that due credit and attribution is given to their original source.
Users should be aware of the process of creating the TCP texts, and therefore of any assumptions that can be made about the data.

Text selection was based on the New Cambridge Bibliography of English Literature (NCBEL). If an author (or for an anonymous work, the title) appears in NCBEL, then their works are eligible for inclusion. Selection was intended to range over a wide variety of subject areas, to reflect the true nature of the print record of the period. In general, first editions of a works in English were prioritized, although there are a number of works in other languages, notably Latin and Welsh, included and sometimes a second or later edition of a work was chosen if there was a compelling reason to do so.

Image sets were sent to external keying companies for transcription and basic encoding. Quality assurance was then carried out by editorial teams in Oxford and Michigan. 5% (or 5 pages, whichever is the greater) of each text was proofread for accuracy and those which did not meet QA standards were returned to the keyers to be redone. After proofreading, the encoding was enhanced and/or corrected and characters marked as illegible were corrected where possible up to a limit of 100 instances per text. Any remaining illegibles were encoded as <gap>s. Understanding these processes should make clear that, while the overall quality of TCP data is very good, some errors will remain and some readable characters will be marked as illegible. Users should bear in mind that in all likelihood such instances will never have been looked at by a TCP editor.
The texts were encoded and linked to page images in accordance with level 4 of the TEI in Libraries guidelines.

Copies of the texts have been issued variously as SGML (TCP schema; ASCII text with mnemonic sdata character entities); displayable XML (TCP schema; characters represented either as UTF-8 Unicode or text strings within braces); or lossless XML (TEI P5, characters represented either as UTF-8 Unicode or TEI g elements).
Keying and markup guidelines are available at the Text Creation Partnership web site.

revisionDesc.change: 2007-08 AptaraKeyed and coded from ProQuest page images

div.head: STATVTA.

list.item:
1 SChedula ſive repertorium ſeriei & Circnitus praedicti, manu propria Cancellarij, Ʋicecancellarij, & Collegij cuiuſ
que
& Aulae Praefecti, in Archivis Ʋniverſitatis vna cum alijs monumentis reponatur, habeant
que
ſingula Collegia exemplar Authenticum, vnde vices ſuas certo poſſint cognoſcere.

2 Neminem ad muneris Procuratorij dignitatem admitti fas eſto, priuſquam quatuor annos, à ſuſcepto Magiſterij gradu (hoc eſt à die creationis ſuae in Comitijs publicis) compleverit, vel poſtquam annum decimum exceſſerit ab eodem die terminando Decennium.
3 Nullus gradu aliquo in Theologia, vel Iure, vel Medicina, inſignitus, Procuratoris munus obibit, nec (niſi officio depoſito) ad gradum aliquem Procurator quivis eodem anno promoveatur.
4 Die Mercurij poſt primam Dominicam in Quadrageſima, in ſingulis Collegijs, ſecundum ordinem praeſcriptum quotannis Procuratorum fiat electio.

5 Die Mercurij, hebdomadam Paſchatis proxime ſequente, tempore pomeridiano, in Domo Convocationis, eorundem peragatur admiſſio, quibus loco & tempore, Procuratores anni ſuperioris Inſignia officij ſui deponant, cum Oratiuncula (vt ſolet) & deinde, ſtatim novi in Domo Convocationis ſecundum formam, iam olim vſitatam, per Ʋicecancellarium admittantur.

6 Procuratoribus vero, ſic (vt praefertur) per Ʋicecancellarium adſumendis Praefecti Collegiorum eligentium, vnà cum caeteris corundem Alumnis, ſinguli ornamentis gradui ſuo competentibus ornati, Comitatum ad Templum Beatae Mariae Ʋirginis eundo exhibeant perſonalem: qui quidem Praefecti & Deputati, Procuratores reſpective ſuos ſecundum ritum antiquum admittendos Ʋicecancellario praeſentabunt. In ſenioris Procuratoris locum aſſumetur, qui in ſerie Magiſtrorum eiſdem Comitijs creatorum ſecundum diſpoſitionem Procuratorum (vti moris eſt) ordine prior collocatur.

7 In Electione Procuratorum in Collegijs facienda, Doctoribus tantùm, & Magiſtris in Artibus, actualiter creatis, eiuſdem Collegij ſuffragandi ius competat.— Quod ſi privata cuiuſvis Collegij ſtatuta, aliam electionis domeſticae formam praefiniverint, cuius obſervationi Iuramenti vinculo arctius aſtringuntur, in hoc caſu (nec alias vnquam) ad evitandum periurij periculum, praeſcriptam immutandi Electionis formam poteſtatem facimus. —Nullus Convictor ſeu Commenſalis in hac Electione ſuffragandi privilegio gaudebit, qui non à primo ad Academiam adventu in Collegium, ea vice Procuratorem nominaturum, admiſſus non noviter aſcitus fuerit, in eo
que educatus, electionis huius tempore ibidem reſidet & commoratur.—Reſidentes verò interpretamur, omnes Collegiorum Socios, Scholares, Clericos, Capellanos ſeu quocun
que alio vocabulo in charta fundationis eiuſdem nominati, & dotati inveniuntur.—Convictores non item niſi per ſex menſes in anno electionem huiuſmodi immediatè praecedente, in eodem perſonaliter reſederint.

8 Procuratorem in vnoquo
que Collegio (provt vices poſtulant) ritè & legitimè Electum decernimus, quem maior pars ſuffragantium nominabit, quod ſi duo, pari vter
que
numero ſuffragiorum nominentur, ille pro electo habeatur, quem Praefectus vel (eo abſente ſeu ſede vacante) eius vicem gerens nominabit. Sin plures nominentur, nec vnus aliquis maiorem partem ſuffragiorum omnium retulerit, nec eodem die eam ob cauſam Electio abſolutae fuerit, & ante horam nonam veſpertinam Vicecancellario renuntiata. Collegium iſtud ius praeſentandi, iſta vice amittat, & ad Vicecancellarium ſpectabit nominatio, qui intra biduum aptam perſonam & ſecundum conditiones ſuperius aſſignatas, habilem, ex Aularum aliquâ aſſumendam in Procuratorem cooptabit.

9 Si nullus, in Collegio Procuratorem deſignaturo, habilis reperiatur, qui poſſit, & velit iſtud munus ſubire, tunc Collegij iſtius Praefectus, vel (eo abſente aut ſede vacante) eius vicem gerens die Electionis conſtituto, alium (quem voluerit) habilem, in Aularum aliqua degentem nominabit, qui deinde in Procuratorem aſſumetur.

10 Si Procuratorem aliquem mori contigerit, vel quavis de cauſa ante anni ſui expirationem, officio ſuo cedere locum eius ſupplebit alius eiuſdem Collegij habilis & idoneus, per Praefectum ſeu (eo abſente aut ſede vacante) eius vicem gerentem, intra ſeptimanam poſt mortem nominandus. Quod ſi talis non extiterit, tunc Vicecancellarius, aliquem habilem in Aularum quacun
que
commorantem, in Procuratorem ſubſtituet, Vt ſupra.

11 Nemini Procuratoris abſentis vices, ad quamcun
que
muneris iſtius expeditionem ſupplere licebit, qui tres annos à ſuſcepto Magiſterij gradu, non comple verit.

12 Ʋt Aularum, (quae in Procuratorum nominatione nullas vices obtinent) ratio aliqua habeatur, Volumus, vt quolibet quarto anno, qui Procuratoris iunioris locum ſortitur, ſeniorem in Comitijs eiuſdem anni Magiſtrum, Aulae alicuius Alumnum deſignet.—Procurator verò ſenior quolibet anno quinquennio Magiſtrum etiam in Aularum aliqua degentem ſcholis praeficiat.

13 Vt etiam tumultuatio iſta, & moleſtiae, circa Electionem Collectorum Quadrageſimalium, penitùs tollantur, Statuimus, quòd Procuratores pro tempore exiſtentes, in Feſto Ovorum, Collectores antedictos deſignabunt, ſinguli vnum, quem viſum fuerit, in Collegio quocun
que
vel Aula degentem. Quorum admiſſio, modo vel forma, per Domum Convocationis aſſignanda celebrabitur. Et, niſi ad alterum ratione promotionis (ſecundum Statuta Vniverſitatis) Senioritatis ius pertinuerit, qui prius ad Gradum Baccalaurei in Artibus praeſentatus & admiſſus fuerit, Senioris locum occupabit.—At
que
hi Collectores, Claſſes Determinantium in Quadrage ſima, & caetera quae ſecundum morem antiquum ſui muneris ſunt praeſtituent & ordinabunt: Si vero Procurator quivis, circa Collationem officij Collectoris praedicti pretij accepti, ſeu repetundarum, convictus fuerit, idem eo ipſo officio ſuo ſubmovebitur, & feuda quaecun
que ſeu pecuniarum ſummas, à Baccalaureis eiuſdem anni per eum acceptas in vſum Ciſtae Academica praeſentis Statuti vigore Vicecancellario refundere tenebitur.

14 Si ambiguitas aliqua, vel dubium aliquod, praeter praenominata occurrat, circa Electionem, modo praefinito in Collegijs faciendam, ne gliſcente inter partes diſcordia, ſcandalum exinde oriatur, per Vicecancellarium, Doctorem in Theologia ſeniorem, modo ſit praefectus Collegij alicuius, tempore Electionis Domi praeſentem, & Praefectum Collegij in Electione tunc temporis intereſſe habentem, vel horum duos, (quorum Collegij Praefectum vnum eſſe volumus) controverſia iſtiuſmodi terminetur. Quod ſi Praefectus Collegij antedictus, tunc temporis Ʋicecancellarij locum obtinuerit, tunc duos in Theologia Doctores, maxime ſeniores (ſed Collegiorum vt praefertur praefect os) ſibi aſſumat, quibuſcum cauſae iſtius cognitionem habeat.

div.p:
At
que haec Statuta ſingulaſ
que corundem particulas, nulli Diſpenſationi quavis de cauſa ſub praetextu quoviſmodo obnoxia perpetuo inviolata manere volumus.

Quas quidem Ordinationes, Statuta, & Decreta, Sereniſſimae Regiae Maieſtatis, ſic vt praemittitur in Domo Convocationis, aperta voce lecta & publicata (non obſtantibus quibuſcun
que
statutis ante hac editis) celebris ille coetus Doctorum, Magiſtrorum Regentium & non Regentium ſumma cum acclamatione, omni
que
animi alacritate acceptârunt, & vnanimi omnium conſenſu confirmârunt, & ratificârunt: Literaſ
que gratulatorias, ſereniſſimae Regiae Majestati, nec non Cancellario noſtro honoratiſſimo, ab Academia mittendas decreverunt.
OXONIAE, Excudebat Iohannes Lichfield, impenſis Guilielmi Davis, A. D. 1629.
